title: 4 Ways to get Hidden Browser Toolbars Back

steps.title: Make sure that you aren't using Chrome in full-screen mode.
steps.content: Make sure that you aren't using Chrome in full-screen mode. Full-screen mode can cause toolbars to disappear and getting out of this mode is as simple as clicking the x that appears as you move your mouse to the top of your screen. There are other ways to do this and they vary depending on your computer type: Windows - Press F11 (or Fn + F11 ). Mac - Hover your mouse at the top of the screen, then click the green circle in the top-left corner of the screen when it appears.

steps.title: Enable the toolbar's extension.
steps.content: Enable the toolbar's extension. Since Chrome uses extensions to add toolbars, you'll be able to enable any non-working toolbars from here. [1] X Research source Click the three-line menu icon (also called the hamburger icon) in the top right corner of your screen, then click More tools > Extensions . If you can't find the toolbar that you want from this list, you may first have to reinstall the extension . Check the " Enabled " box to the right of the toolbar extension, then check the "Allow in incognito" box below the toolbar if you want to use the toolbar in incognito mode.

steps.title: Enable the bookmarks bar.
steps.content: Enable the bookmarks bar. If enabling your toolbar didn't fix your problem, you're most likely looking to enable the bookmarks bar. To do so: [2] X Research source Click ⋮ Select Bookmarks Click Show bookmarks bar

steps.title: Run a virus scan.
steps.content: Run a virus scan. If your toolbars still won't work properly, you may have a virus on your computer. Scanning your computer with antivirus software will determine whether or not this is the case; if you do have a virus, the software will usually eliminate it.

steps.title: Make sure that you open Safari in window mode rather than full-screen.
steps.content: Make sure that you open Safari in window mode rather than full-screen. If Safari is already open and in full-screen mode, hover your cursor at the top of the screen, then click the green button in the upper-left side of the screen when it appears. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click View.
steps.content: Click View . This menu item is at the top of the screen. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Show Toolbar.
steps.content: Click Show Toolbar . It's near the bottom of the View drop-down menu. Doing so should bring your toolbar back up. [5] X Research source You can also click Show Path Bar and Show Tab Bar here if you're missing the URL text box or the tab view at the top of Safari. If you see Hide Toolbar here instead, click Hide Toolbar and then click Show Toolbar to re-activate it.

steps.title: Customize your toolbar.
steps.content: Customize your toolbar. To do so: [6] X Research source Click View Click Customize Toolbar... Click and drag items from the menu up onto the toolbar.

steps.title: Run a virus scan.
steps.content: Run a virus scan. If your toolbar keeps disappearing even though you've activated it, you may have a piece of malware on your Mac that's preventing the toolbar from loading when you open Safari. A virus scan should help remove the malware.

steps.title: Make sure that you aren't in full-screen mode.
steps.content: Make sure that you aren't in full-screen mode. If you are in full-screen mode, exit it by doing the following: [7] X Research source Windows - Press F11 (or Fn + F11 ) to exit full-screen mode. Mac - Hover your mouse at the top of the screen, then click the green circle in the top-left corner of the screen when it appears.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . It's in the top-right corner of the window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Add-ons.
steps.content: Click Add-ons . This option is in the drop-down menu. Doing so opens the Add-Ons page. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Extensions tab.
steps.content: Click the Extensions tab. You'll find it in the upper-left side of the page.

steps.title: Find your toolbar extension.
steps.content: Find your toolbar extension. Scroll up or down to find the extension that serves as the toolbar that you want to enable.

steps.title: Click Enable.
steps.content: Click Enable . It's to the right of the extension's name. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click Restart now when prompted.
steps.content: Click Restart now when prompted. You'll see this link pop up above the toolbar that you're enabling. Firefox will restart; when it finishes restarting, your toolbar should be back.

steps.title: Enable default toolbars.
steps.content: Enable default toolbars. If enabling your add-on toolbar didn't solve your problem, you'll most likely need to enable default toolbars. To do so: Click View (on Windows, press the Alt key first) Select Toolbars Click a toolbar that you want to enable (e.g., Bookmarks Toolbar ) Repeat for remaining toolbars if needed.

steps.title: Customize your toolbar.
steps.content: Customize your toolbar. [10] X Research source Click ☰ Click Customize... Make sure that "Toolbars" is selected in the drop-down menu at the bottom of the page. Click and drag toolbar options from the middle of the page to the upper-right side of the window.

steps.title: Run a virus scan.
steps.content: Run a virus scan. If your toolbars still won't work properly, you may have a virus on your computer. Scanning your computer with antivirus software will determine whether or not this is the case; if you do have a virus, the software will usually eliminate it.

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . This icon is in the top-right corner of the browser window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Extensions.
steps.content: Click Extensions . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu. [11] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select your toolbar.
steps.content: Select your toolbar. You may need to scroll down to find the toolbar that you want to use. Once you find it, click it to select it.

steps.title: Click the white switch below the toolbar's name .
steps.content: Click the white switch below the toolbar's name . It will turn back on . This will enable the toolbar's service, as well as the switch below it that's labeled "Show button next to the address bar". [12] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You can repeat this process for other missing or hidden toolbars by clicking the "Back" arrow in the top-left side of the menu and then selecting a different service.

steps.title: Run a virus scan.
steps.content: Run a virus scan. If your toolbars still won't work properly, you may have a virus on your computer. Scanning your computer with antivirus software will determine whether or not this is the case; if you do have a virus, the software will usually eliminate it.
